intro: Hieracium velutifolium, commonly known as the velvetleaf hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves that are typically velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its growth habit is often found in meadows and disturbed soils. Hieracium velutifolium is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
